questions.question: What is a potential limitation of the UNDELETE command as noted?
options: It can recover files from any disk
It may not be possible to recover files if the disk is reformatted
questions.answer: It may not be possible to recover files if the disk is reformatted

questions.question: What happens if other activities occur on the disk after a file is deleted?
questions.answer: Recovery may not be possible

questions.question: What should be done immediately after using the UNDELETE command?
options: Stop all other activities on the computer and disk
questions.answer: Stop all other activities on the computer and disk

questions.question: What is the result of the command 'C:\COPAIDOS\PRACT\3> UNDELETE TEST2.txt'?
questions.answer: TEST2.txt is recovered if available

questions.question: What does the /DT switch enable in the UNDELETE command?
questions.answer: Delete Tracker protection

questions.question: What is the purpose of the /STATUS switch in the UNDELETE command?
options: To display the protection method in effect
questions.answer: To display the protection method in effect

questions.question: What happens with the command 'C:\COPAIDOS\PRACT\4> UNDELETE /ALL'?
options: Recovers all deleted files without prompting
questions.answer: Recovers all deleted files without prompting

questions.answer: It has no single owner and is managed by a community

submodules.submodule_title: Linux Distributions and Open Source Software

questions.question: What is Red Hat known for in the Linux community?
questions.answer: A billion-dollar commercial Linux company

questions.question: What is a key feature of Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL)?
options: Support for up to seven years after release
questions.answer: Support for up to seven years after release

questions.question: What is Fedora known for in relation to Red Hat?
options: A distro with faster updates but without support
questions.answer: A distro with faster updates but without support

questions.question: What is the main objective of the lesson on Open Source Software (OSS)?
options: To provide history of OSS and examples
questions.answer: To provide history of OSS and examples

questions.question: What is the definition of Open Source Software (OSS)?
options: Software distributed with its source code available for use
questions.answer: Software distributed with its source code available for use

questions.question: Who is credited with initiating the idea of making source code freely available?
questions.answer: Richard Stallman

questions.question: At which institution did Richard Stallman work when he initiated the OSS movement?
questions.answer: MIT

questions.question: What was a key action taken by Richard Stallman to promote OSS?
options: Learned about free code under his own license
questions.answer: Learned about free code under his own license

questions.question: What license did Richard Stallman create that led to the Open Source Initiative?
questions.answer: GNU Public License

questions.question: In what year was the Open Source Initiative formed?
What is the primary goal of the Open Source Initiative (OSI)?
options: To promote and protect open source software
questions.answer: To promote and protect open source software

questions.question: What does OSI provide to support open source software?
options: Repository of source code and community guidelines
questions.answer: Repository of source code and community guidelines

questions.question: What is a key benefit of OSS according to the document?
questions.answer: Encourages collaboration and community support

questions.question: How is OSS work typically stored?
questions.answer: In a public repository

questions.question: Who can contribute to the design and functionality of OSS projects?
options: Anyone with access to the repository
questions.answer: Anyone with access to the repository

They are limited to one version

They can use graphical Linux desktop without need
